docs.text: Kotlin Android Architecture Library - Kaal - by eMan ¶ Usage ¶ All artifacts are available and distributed by using the jcenter() You should you artifact which you need. E.g. a domain artifact you will use in your domain layer, but you can use it also in data and infrastructure, because you need e.g. instance to the Result class. Kaal Core ¶ Kotlin implementation ( "cz.eman.kaal:kaal-core:0.6.0" ) Groovy implementation 'cz.eman.kaal:kaal-core:0.6.0' TBD Kaal Domain ¶ Kotlin implementation ( "cz.eman.kaal:kaal-domain:0.6.0" ) Groovy implementation 'cz.eman.kaal:kaal-domain:0.6.0' TBD Kaal Presentation ¶ Kotlin implementation ( "cz.eman.kaal:kaal-presentation:0.6.0" ) Groovy implementation 'cz.eman.kaal:kaal-presentation:0.6.0' TBD Kaal Infrastructure ¶ Kotlin implementation ( "cz.eman.kaal:kaal-infrastructure:0.6.0" ) Groovy implementation 'cz.eman.kaal:kaal-infrastructure:0.6.0' TBD Responsible Persons ¶ Václav Souhrada Roman Holomek Štefan Toth Filip Šmíd

Kotlin Android Architecture Library - Kaal - by eMan

docs.text: All artifacts are available and distributed by using the jcenter() You should you artifact which you need. E.g. a domain artifact you will use in your domain layer, but you can use it also in data and infrastructure, because you need e.g. instance to the Result class.
